transportAdvice: Houston is a sprawling, car-dependent city where walking between attractions is generally impractical; renting a car or using taxis and ride-hailing services is the most convenient way to get around. A light rail system and bus network exist but offer limited coverage of tourist areas, so most visitors rely on private transportation.

weather.description: Mild and occasionally cool with some rainy days; light layers are advisable.
Temperatures begin to warm slightly but cold fronts can still bring chilly spells.
Spring arrives with pleasant warmth and increasing rainfall; a comfortable time to visit.
Warm and increasingly humid with frequent thunderstorms typical of spring in the Gulf region.
Hot and muggy with heavy rain showers common; outdoor activities are best planned for mornings.
Very hot and humid; air conditioning is essential and heat can feel intense outdoors.
Peak summer heat with oppressive humidity; expect temperatures to feel significantly hotter than the thermometer reads.
Equally hot and humid as July; the height of hurricane season warrants monitoring weather forecasts.
Still very warm and humid with elevated storm risk; tropical weather systems can bring heavy rainfall.
Temperatures become more comfortable as autumn sets in; one of the more pleasant months to visit.
Mild and generally agreeable with cooler evenings; a good time for outdoor exploration.
Cool and occasionally cold with some rain; light to medium winter clothing is recommended.
